result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica Rae Irish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs on Count 1 shall be paid from bond. Bond applied to court costs, court-appointed attorney fees and GAL fees in 22JC2 and 22JC3.
Court waives costs on remaining counts.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not go upon the property of CM / DM in Bagley.  Defendant may have contact with CM/DM but that contact shall occur only between the hours of 8am and 8pm. The defendant shall not engage in harassing conduct, the definition of harassment being that from Section 813.125(1)(am)(2).  That being engaging in a course of conduct or repeatedly committing acts which harass or intimidate another person and which serve no legitimate purpose. The legitimate purpose here is to organize contact between defendant and her children and for the CM/DM to inquire about Ms. Irish's well-being

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Plea and sentencing hearing (partial) judge's sentence 9/7/2022
for payment of attorney fees
Probation sentence vacated

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jessica Rae Irish.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to vacate probation. Court reviews rights to vacate probation and vacates. State requests 30 days jail, each count, court costs on one count, concurrent. Attorney Kieler heard. Defendant heard. Court orders 90 days jail on Count 1 and 1 year on Count 2, concurrent with each other and 22CF77, court costs on Count 1. Huber granted. Credit of 49 days plus credit on prior judgment.
Hearing on September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
to Court re: 9/7/22 hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jessica Rae Irish in court.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jessica Rae Irish. There is no agreement in this case. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest charges. Defendant and Attorney Kieler have short discussion. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of charges. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State remains silent as to sentencing. Attorney Ryan Kieler heard on sentencing. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation for Ct 1 and 1 year probation for Ct 2 with the following conditions: Defendant shall not go upon the property of CM / DM in Bagley.  Defendant may have contact with CM/DM but that contact shall occur only between the hours of 8am and 8pm. The defendant shall not engage in harassing conduct, the definition of harassment being that from Section 813.125(1)(am)(2).  That being engaging in a course of conduct or repeatedly committing acts which harass or intimidate another person and which serve no legitimate purpose. The legitimate purpose here is to organize contact between defendant and her children and for the CM/DM to inquire about Ms. Irish's well-being; to have such assessment, treatment, counseling, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, to pay 1 set of court costs, and to submit a DNA sample. If revoked, 12 days credit granted.
Denied

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jessica Rae Irish. Matter is resolved, Attorney Kieler requests a plea and sentencing date. Plea and sentencing date set.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Amended

Defendant shall not go upon the property of CM / DM in Bagley.  Defendant may have contact with Mr. and Mrs. Martin but that contact shall occur only between the hours of 8am and 8pm.  The bond will prohibit harassing conduct, the definition of harassment being that from Section 813.125(1)(am)(2).  That being engaging in a course of conduct or repeatedly committing acts which harass or intimidate another person and which serve no legitimate purpose. The legitimate purpose here is to organize contact between the Defendant and her children and for the Martins to inquire about Defendant's well-being.
Defendant shall not have contact with children unless expressly allowed by Social Services.
Defendant shall submit to random observed drug testing upon request of law enforcement or court designee.

Defendant Jessica Irish appears in court, in custody at Grant County jail. Attorney Anthony Pozorski appears in court for the State. Attorney Ryan Kieler appears in court. Court order competency exam.
cc DHS 4/28/22 kb
for withdrawal of counsel

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish appeared by video from GCJ.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jessica Rae Irish. Deputy Underwood sworn and testifies. State request judicial notice be taken in Grant co. case 22CF28. No obj. Court takes judicial notice as requested. Cross-examined. State requesting bind over. Def. objects but withholds argument. Court finds probable cause found and binds over. Motion to withdraw discussed. Atty Kieler willing to stay on if Def. wishes. Defendant wants a new attorney.  Competency to be addressed in this case with new counsel. Following arraignment court grants attorney Kieler to withdraw. Defendant pleads Not guilty. Court also grants atty Kieler request to withdraw in case 22CF28 and will sign both orders. Court will appoint new counsel for these cases. Status - May 11, 2022 @ 2:00 pm
Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on May 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she's a fulltime mom. States Ryan Kieler is her attorney. Court disconnects as defendant keeps interrupting. Court will appoint Attorney Ryan Kieler. Preliminary hearing set.

Defendant shall not be on the premises of her parents property.
Defendant shall only have contact with DM and CM by phone.
Defendant shall not have contact with children unless expressly allowed by Social Services.
Defendant shall submit to random observed drug testing upon request of law enforcement or court designee. 
Defendant shall contact State Public Defender's Office as soon as possible.

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Kieler is appointed in other pending cases. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests $500 cash bond with conditions to only have contact with mother, father, and her children by phone and to submit to random drug testing. Defendant heard on bond. Court heard and orders $500 cash bond with conditions to not be on property of her parents, contact with DM and CM only by phone, not to contact children unless expressly allowed by Social Services, submit to random, observed, drug testing upon request of law enforcement, or court designee and to contact SPD as soon as possible. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.
